- Asia-Pacific - FTSE EM Small Cap : S Inc F Inc, 2436 TT (Weltrerd Semiconductor Inc), 0.61 Mln shares to buy, 0.58 days to trade- Asia-Pacific - FTSE EM Small Cap : F Inc, SAILIFE IN (Sai Life Sciences Ltd), 1.06 Mln shares to buy, 0.31 days to trade- Asia-Pacific - FTSE EM Small Cap : F Inc, CLEAN IN (Clean Science Technology L), 0.88 Mln shares to buy, 2.55 days to trade- Europe - MSCI DM Small Cap : F Inc, LINK NO (Link Mobility Group), 1.20 Mln shares to buy, 0.68 days to trade

- MSCI Norway Small Cap - Abry Partners sold 45,000,000 shares of LINK MOBILITY GROUP (LMG) at NOK 30 per share to institutional investors. MSCI will maintain LMG in MSCI Global Small Cap Indexes with unchanged NOS & increased FIF, incl. updates, as of close of Sep 1 (eff. Sep 2).- Indexer demand: 1.20 million shares of LINK NO (68% volume)- Effective as close of Monday, September 1, 2025- [Review Amendments] FTSE Ireland: AIB will have free float increase as part of FTSE Sep-2025 review.- Indexer demand: 2.75 million shares of AIBG ID (77% volume)- Effective as close of Friday, September 19, 2025
-Effective as close of Tuesday, September 2025

- MSCI USA Small Cap - DICKS SPORTING GOODS, a current constituent of MSCI Global Standard Indexes, intends to require FOOT LOCKER via agreement. For every share held, FOOT LOCKER shareholders can elect to receive: cash USD 24.00 (default option) or 0.1168 DICKS SPORTING GOODS shares. The last day for FOOT LOCKER shareholders to elect the consideration is August 29, 2025. The regulatory approvals have been received. The FOOT LOCKER shareholders meeting scheduled on August 22, 2025 approved the transaction. The last trading day of FOOT LOCKER on the New York Stock Exchange is expected to be on September 05, 2025. MSCI intends to delete FOOT LOCKER from the MSCI Global Small Cap Indexes as of the September 05, 2025 (effective September 08, 2025) using the closing market price, if trading, else using the default option of USD 24.00. MSCI will continue to closely monitor the event and if the election results are available at the time of sending the "Confirmed" announcement, MSCI intends to make the corresponding changes in Number of Shares (NOS) and Foreign Inclusion Factor (FIF), if any, to DICKS SPORTING GOODS. - Indexer supply: - 1.18 million shares of FL US (- 26% volume) - Effective as close of Friday, September 5, 2025

- S&PTSX Composite - The shareholders of Pan American Silver Corp (TSX: PAAS) and MAG Silver Corp. (TSX:MAG) have agreed to the terms of a Plan of Arrangement resulting in the combination of the two companies. Each share of Pan American Silver will be exchanged for US\(20.54 in cash or 0.755 shares of Pan American Silver for each MAG Silver share held, subject to proration such that the aggregate consideration paid to MAG Silver consists of US\)500 million cash and the remaining consideration in Pan American Silver shares. In anticipation of shareholder approval and the arrangement closing, MAG Silver will be removed from all S&P/TSX indices where the stock is a constituent prior to the open of trading on September 4, 2025. The shares outstanding of Pan American Silver will be increased at the same time to reflect the issuance of shares. Accordingly, the new shares outstanding of Pan American Silver will be increased with a decreased IWF in the S&P/TSX indices.

- Indexer supply: -5.12 million shares of MAG CN (-1469% volume) **Indexers may exchange, thereby reducing the flow**-Indexer demand: 3.05 million shares of PAAS CN (173% volume) **Indexers may exchange, thereby reducing the flow**-Effective as close of Wednesday, September 3, 2025

- Frasers Property Hospitality Trust Holdings Pte. Ltd. intends to acquire FRASERS HOSPITALITY TRST (FT) via cash scheme of SGD 0.71 per share. MSCI intends to delete FT using closing market price as of close of Sept 11, 2025 (effective Sept 12, 2025).  
- Indexer supply: -15.41 million shares of FHT SP (-641% volume)

- FTSE Australia: Following the receipt of updated shares in issue information for Lynas Corp (Australia, constituent) as a result of primary offering, Lynas Corp (Australia, 6121176) will remain in the index with an increased shares in issue total from 934,718,185 to 991,321,959 and an unchanged investability weighting of 96.2761%.  
- Indexer demand: 1.57 million shares of LYC AU (19% volume)  
- Effective as close of Tuesday, September 2, 2025

- FTSE All World All Cap Index Review - September 2025: On August 22, 2025, FTSE announced the confirmed changes for its quarterly review of the FTSE All World All Cap index series including additions and deletions. The announced changes will be implemented after the close on September 19th (effective starting September 22nd open). In Developed Market, There will be 133 addition, 104 deletions, 1079 other changes. Overall 2-way turnover is 0.83%. The largest country contributors are USA (0.42%): 18 Additions and 66 Deletions, Japan (0.06%): 10 Additions and 9 Deletions, United Kingdom (0.06%): 1 Additions and 8 Deletions. The total trade size of the rebalance is estimated at \(22.1 billion in total. In Emerging Market, There will be 142 addition, 43 deletions, 462 other changes. Overall 2-way turnover is 2.62%. The largest country contributors are China (0.91%): 87 Additions and 9 Deletions, India (0.40%): 12 Additions and 1 Deletions, Taiwan (0.38%): 8 Additions and 8 Deletions. The total trade size of the rebalance is estimated at\) 8.7 billion in total.

- MSCI Country Classification Review 2025: MSCI announces the results of its Annual Market Classification Review after the US market close on June 24, 2025. Select highlights of this year's review includes: 1) MSCI will continue to review the implementation and market adoption of measures to enhance the accessibility of the Korean equity market. 2) MSCI provided updates on the market classification status of Greece regarding potential upgrade from Emerging Market to Developed Market. 3) The consultation on a potential reclassification of Bulgaria from Standalone to Frontier Market status will be extended to June 2026. 4) MSCI will continue to monitor the market accessibility of the Bangladesh equity market.

- J.P. Morgan 2025 Global ETF Handbook: The 2025 J.P. Morgan ETF Handbook provides a detailed overview of the \(\sim\) 515 Tr global ETF market. The first part of the report describes ETF markets in the Americas, Europe and Asia, and discusses new market developments and trends in the industry. Topics discussed include actively managed ETFs, option-based ETFs, cryptocurrency ETFs, the ETF/mutual fund dual-share-class proposal, fixed income ETFs, levered ETFs, single stock ETFs, conversions, new launches, fees, liquidity, ETF options, and investor flows. The second part of the report provides a categorized listing of US ETFs (with AUM \(\geq\) 100Mn), grouped by asset class and market segment. Additionally, you can access a comprehensive electronic database of all ETFs trading worldwide here.

- FTSE Country Classification Review 2024: Greece added to watchlist for potential upgrade to Developed Market status: FTSE announced the results of its annual country classification review on October 8, 2024. Egypt will be removed from the watchlist for

potential demotion to Unclassified market status, as there have been no delays in capital repatriation since March 2024. Vietnam remains on the watchlist for potential reclassification to Secondary Emerging market status, with ongoing issues in settlement cycles and foreign ownership limits, despite government support for market reforms. It will again be reviewed in Mar- 2025 Interim Country classification review. Greece has been added to the watchlist for potential promotion to Developed market status, meeting all FTSE Quality of Matrix criteria but still requiring an improved creditworthiness rating. If promoted, Greece could see a net outflow of approximately \(\) 75\$ million from the passive index trackers.

- FTSE Equity Country Classification March 2025 Interim Announcement- FTSE published interim Update of Equity Country Classification Announcement on \(8^{\text{th}}\) April, 2025. - FTSE will retain Greece on the the Watch List for possible reclassification from Advanced Emerging to Developed market status. FTSE will provide update as part of the September 2025 Annual Review. FTSE noted that Greece meets the twenty-two FTSE Quality of Markets criteria, the minimum investable market capitalisation and securities count requirement based on data as of the close on 31 December 2024 and has a GNI rating of 'High'. The current Credit Worthiness rating of 'Speculative' for Greece is under review following the recent upgrade in the sovereign debt rating of Greece by one of the primary credit rating agencies. Additionally, the minimum investable market capitalisation and securities count requirement for Greece will be evaluated based on data as of the close on 30 June 2025. - FTSE will retain Vietnam on the Watch List for possible reclassification from Frontier to Secondary Emerging market status; an update on the Watch List status of Vietnam will be provided as part of the September 2025 Annual Review.

- The J.P. Morgan 2025 Global Index Handbook contains an overview of passive indexation, a special topic on trading index changes, a summary of index methodologies employed by major index providers, as well as a detailed schedule of index rebalance events in 2024 globally.
Please let us know if you have any feedback or questions. Regards
Global Quantitative & Derivative Strategy J.P. Morgan Securities LLC

Analyst Certification: The Research Analyst(s) denoted by an "AC" on the cover of this report certifies (or, where multiple Research Analysts are primarily responsible for this report, the Research Analyst denoted by an "AC" on the cover or within the document individually certifies, with respect to each security or issuer that the Research Analyst covers in this research) that: (1) all of the views expressed in this report accurately reflect the Research Analyst's personal views about any and all of the subject securities or issuers; and (2) no part of any of the Research Analyst's compensation was, is, or will be directly or indirectly related to the specific recommendations or views expressed by the Research Analyst(s) in this report. All authors named within this report are Research Analysts who produce independent research unless otherwise specified. In Europe, Sector Specialists (Sales and Trading) may be shown on this report as contacts but are not authors of the report or part of the Research Department.

J.P. Morgan uses the following rating system: Overweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will outperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); Neutral (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will perform in line with the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); and Underweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe. NR is Not Rated. In this case, J.P. Morgan has removed the rating and, if applicable, the price target, for this stock because of either a lack of a sufficient fundamental basis or for legal, regulatory or policy reasons. The previous rating and, if applicable, the price target, no longer should be relied upon. An NR designation is not a recommendation or a rating. In Americas equity research, some stocks under coverage have a rating but no price target; in these cases, we expect the stock will outperform/perform in line/underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe over the next six to 12 months. In our Asia (ex- Australia and ex- India) and U.K. small- and mid- cap Equity Research, each stock's expected total return is compared to the expected total return of a benchmark country market index, not to those Research Analyst's coverage universe. If it does not appear in the Important Disclosures section of this report, the certifying Research Analyst's coverage universe can be found on J.P. Morgan's Research website, https://www.jpmorganmarkets.com.
